record.field: 1. Basics elements of Video Editing are:
2. A video consists of a sequence of
A. Main elements of video footage that enhance the narrative
B. Main footage of main subjects of your narrative
C. Cut from motion in the first shot
D. Footage shot out of order or at separate times
5. In which stage do you edit video?
6. What is the place called where we drag all the footage?
7. Video Editing is the process of:
8. What are the three elements of the story?
9. Which video editing rule says that two characters in a scene should maintain the same left/right relationship to one another?
10. You can cover a jump shot with
A. A different angle of the shot
B. A different shot all together
11. Identify a disadvantage of an analog signal
C. When copied, quality goes down
12. Which term describes the tiny dots that make up a video image?
13. Editing is almost an art form because _____
A. You have to know what to cut to make people look good
B. You are trying to cover up the mistakes of the director and cameraman
C. You are blending together images and sound to make a connected piece
D. It's not really an art, it's just moving things around to look good
C. Rolling them in the projector

15. You have two 5-second video clips back to back in your timeline on V1. You move the second clip up to V2 and earlier by 5 seconds and reduce its opacity to 50%. What will change when you play back?
A. Only the first clip will be visible
B. Only the second clip will be visible
C. Nothing; the clips will play exactly as they did before
D. The two clips will be dissolved together
16. The special effects technique of making a specific hue or color within a clip transparent, revealing another video layer below, is known as:
17. Choose the answer which correctly lists HD video codecs in order of compression quality, from least compression to most:
18. How many frames does NTSC Drop Frame timecode omit in each 10 minute interval?
D. Both black and white only
19. You have two 5-second video clips back to back in your timeline on V1. You move the first clip up to V2 and later by 5 seconds. What will change when you play back?
A. Nothing; the clips will play exactly as they did before
B. Only the second clip will be visible
C. The two clips will be dissolved together
D. Only the first clip will be visible
20. You have set no In or Out Points in source or sequence. What happens when you perform an overwrite edit?
A. You cannot perform an overwrite edit without outpoints
B. The first frame of source and sequence act as In Points; the Out Point will be the end of the source clip
C. The location of the playheads act as In Points; the Out Point will be the end of the source clip.
21. What happens when a 40 second clip is edited into a 5 second hole using Insert Edit?
A. Everything in the sequence is moved forward by 40 seconds to accommodate the clip
B. The clip is sped up to 800%
C. The clip overwrites the following 35 seconds
22. What elements are essential in a STORYBOARD?
A. Drawing inside a panel, camera, time, description, music and sound effects
23. Editing is the process of cutting out the bad parts. True or false?
24. Camera work is at the center of video production. True or False?
25. How is the power of editing shown with the video of the man and the baby?
A. We are convinced the baby is scared of the man
B. We are not aware that the baby and the man cannot see each other
D. The editor is able to fool the audience
26. What do they mean that 1+1=3 or 50 in editing?
A. It means editing allows you to play tricks on the mind of the viewer
B. It means editing is hard to explain to others
C. It means editing makes no sense to anyone
D. It means that sometimes you just have to guess, because there isn't a right answer
27. What is different about the editing of the 2nd clip, of the same man and a woman?
A. What is different about the editing of the 2nd clip, of the same man and a woman?
B. The emotions of the man changed
C. The editing changed the audience's perception of the man's emotion
28. In the 3rd clip, the editor convinces the audience that the man is hungry. How?
A. By adding a voice over of the man saying he is hungry
B. By adding a clip of people eating
C. By adding a clip of a hamburger
29. In the football video, one person is able to cover 4 shots simultaneously. How?
B. He edited shots from the beginning of the game into shots from the end of the game
C. He had a friend also taking video
D. He stole footage from another camera man
30. If ending with a wide shot, _____
A. Use the same shot you started with to remind the audience of location
B. Don't ever use a wide shot to end a sequence, just continue to get "tighter" (closer)
D. Use a different wide shot than the one you started with
